Review:

Wow!! A beautiful short book with characters, I would love to reread again.

The story is of Sooraj and Ridhi. In the beginning of the story we introduce to Sooraj and how he's struggling to perfect person in Tinder to get lucky. And also meets his two beautiful, funny friends. Then we meets Ridhi, and comes to know their story. Two childhood friends who becomes lovers, share their all beautiful firsts together, a perfect love story. But then one day it's not anymore. And in this story we gets to see that if their loves is really ends or not.

A mature romance book, with mature characters, talks about real things, or ignore them and the characters with their flaws and mistakes and the way they lead their life makes them more real, more relatable at times.

I love Sooraj and Ridhi, I love their relationship. Two totally different persons, who respects each other for everything they are, but still not ready to discuss their real problems. Yes at times I get annoyed with Sooraj and his thought process, he's still interesting to read about.

Even though the story is short, it's still intriguing enough to read, about how an imperfect relationship can also be perfect in many ways. A must read.

A PERFECT LOVE STORYâ€¦UNTIL IT WAS NOT... by Prashant Sharma is a story revolving around childhood sweethearts Riddhi and Sooraj. The journey from there slowly finds its space in teenage romance and then in marriage. But do you really think marriage would be the ultimatum of any relationship? The journey after that would be a cakewalk right? Then my dear you're wrong.

I'm so impressed by the author, he puts up all the relatable issues diligently. Priorities may get changed, it's shown boldly. Likewise, Riddhi and Soorajâ€™s married life slowly falls apart or better to say fades away with time when they both realise the worth of each other in their togetherness. Riddhi being an average student always wanted to create something of her own but on the other everything was a competition for Sooraj.

Riddhi cherries her carrier after wasting so many years just getting expensive gifts from her rich husband, which later on turn into a small needle in them. What do you think can be the ending of this so-called perfect marriage? Will there be any marriage? And if it does what does get changed?

Trust me, please don't miss the ending it was so unexpecting (kind of expected something like that may happen but this way was unimaginable). Just a book of 166 pages-1/2 sitting just enough. At some point, you may feel it's a book for mere teenagers just stepping into the genre of love and all, yep the book is written in too simple language like really easy. At some point, I felt the editing part could have been done better. Few personal descriptions and Characterisation were simply inelegant. Expecting things to turn a little more pleasing from his next work.

I learn so much about the book from the blurb itself. So much that I know what to expect and kind of have my predictions about what many happen and unravel in the story.

To be fairly honest, the blurb gives me an impression that the story is quite a cliche and nothing much to hold on to but I was wrong on my judgements. This is why they say "do not judge a book by its cover" because we may never know what we may find in between the book and just how much we are going to love and remember it from time to time.

So, this is a love story, I guess we can all figure that out from the first read itself but one thing that is the element of surprise in this book is that it is not your usual love story. It is filled with actions and developments that one can hardly see that so much time has passed while reading it.

Though the story is not something we haven't heard before, I still had a great time reading this one. It's always fun and nice to follow characters and see how they progress throughout the book. This book is one as such that keeps on pushing you to read forward and wait for the final reveal.

This book is a must-read for everyone. Do read it if you have the chance. Everything is done beautifully. The characters are well developed and the language is clear and straightforward. Such a great read.

Childhood best friends. "IT" couple. We've come across them and are curious about how they got there. What happens when they finally settle down together? "A Perfect Love Story... Until It Was Notâ€¦â€ tells the story of a couple who have known each other for a long time and how things go wrong when they don't discuss the important issues in their relationship.

Sooraj is an intelligent smart, and hardworking engineer turned banker, but he is a sexist, patriarchy-bound male. Trying to be woke in his comfort zone, he has more character flaws than the zeros on his monthly payslip. Ridhi is creative, mature, and compassionate but unambitious, which is a flaw, according to her partner. She has rose-tinted glasses on in most years of her relationship with Sooraj. The plot shifts from the past to the present, where we meet Kareena.

The story is a simple romance with a bit unsettling end. The twist, in the end, can be revolting for some. The repetition of paragraphs made a distaste for the book.

A 166 pages short read with simple language that will make you think about relationships. The story is good, but the writing could have been better.

This is a story of two childhood sweethearts whose teenage romance turned into marriage, followed by a storm in their relationship. People say marriage makes things perfect; it completes you. But in actuality, do such marriages stand the test of time when one wants to follow his or her dreams? Does true love comes at the cost of sacrificing everything for the person you love?

The story is written very nicely with lucid language. The author tried to portray the emotion of love and what happens after it is lost. The author communicated well that priorities change with time, and it's us who have to adapt to such change.

The title and the book cover are beautiful. The ending turned out to be something unexpected. Though the story may feel like a typical love story at times, it creates a new impact towards the end.

Overall, it's an engaging read. I believe readers would love the plot. The story actually contains lots of emotions, which will keep you interested in the book till the end.
